newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - June 13.
newsitem.headline: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - June 13.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:

Broker Deutsche Morgan Grenfell (DMG) said early on Friday it had bought 78.16 million shares in spices and yeast group Burns Philp & Co Ltd at A$2.50 a share for a client that was not an international food group. DMG director Robin Yandle told Reuters he would be active in the stock again later on Friday either as a buyer or a seller, depending on the price. Burns said later on Friday morning it did not know of any takeover bid for the group or the identity of the buyer.
The indentity of the mystery buyer of Burns shares was clearly not Goodman Fielder, DMG said.

News Corp Ltd's shares roared back into favour on Thursday as investors and analysts re-rated the global media group's prospects after it announced two deals to buy and sell U.S. television assets worth US$3 billion. News' ADRS rose another 50 cents or about three percent to US$18.50 in New York early on Friday.
Adsteam Marine, which raised A$160 million through the issue of 80 million shares at A$2 each, listed on Thursday at a 31 percent premium.
Highlands Pacific, which riased A$190 million through the issue of 190 million shares at A$1.00 per share, listed on Thursday and closed at a two percent premium.
The Sydney Morning Herald said Optus Communications chief executive Ziggy Switkowski did not have the support of the board and was about to resign.
Rumours continue to circulate that ANZ may be subject to a takeover bid by HSBC Holdings at a hefty premium. ANZ told the stock exchange on Thursday they knew of no reason for the price rise.
